description.narrative: The Joint Program (JP) aims at shifting the way current resources from both public and private sector are invested and spent to align with national development priorities and priority SDGs.

participating-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

activity-description.narrative: The location of the project is Rabat, Morocco.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)
MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)
MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: Outcome 1 indicators : 1. Ratio of financing for integrated multi-sectoral solutions leveraged in terms of scope ; Baseline : TBD ; 2020 2. Ratio of financing for integrated multi-sectoral solutions leveraged in terms of scale ; Baseline : TBD ; 2020 3. SDGs funding gaps analysed, and SDG correspondence matrix developed ; Baseline : 0 ; 2020 Target : 1 4. Benchmark SDG financing study realised ; Baseline : 0 ; 2020 5. financial services provided under the National financial inclusion strategy to assess their impacts in terms of priority SDGs analysed ; Baseline : 0 6. SDG Financing and impact investing ecosystem mapping conducted ; Baseline : 0; 7. Social funds impact framework using innovative models developed; Baseline : 0 ; 2020 8. Moroccan financial architecture gender marker ; Baseline : 0 ; 2020

Ministry Of Foreign Affairs African Cooperation And Moroccan Expatriates and Ministry of Economy and finaces have been informed officially about the acceptance of the Joined programme. UN agencies received the fund. 2 meetings held with the Ministry of Finances to discuss how to analyse the current public budget system and establish a correlation matrix between SDGs and budget lines. The analysis will focus on two main sectors namely Health and education. ToRs are under finalisation. 2 meeting held with UN focal points to agree on the JP governance modality. The project will be officially launch during november. The most significant challenges are related to COVID 19 impact and duration, being unpredictable, and possible shifts in priorities which might translate into GoM deciding not to proceed with certain studies and delays in implementation.
